title.narrative: READ - Write the Lyrics to a Better World

description.narrative: Literacy is the key to a better life and a key factor in promoting sustainable development. This communication and advocacy campaign promotes the understanding of the importance of literacy and the related goals of sustainable development (Agenda 2030) for young people and the general public and encourages them to become acquainted with the reality of young people in developing countries. The project provides information on the situation of literacy in developing countries especially for upper secondary sch ools. The campaign is carried out in cooperation with Alma Media. Four high school classes around Finland participate in workshops where they produce the content of the campaign. Literacy is approached with creative methods that allow the experiential unde rstanding of the theme. The experience is enhanced by the content produced by the Senegalese and Paraguayan youth. The workshops culminate in events organized by the youth in schools. A visiting Inspirer a public figure will also attend the events and brin g additional visibility to the project. As part of the communication campaign schools across Finland are challenged to address literacy and sustainable development goals. Teachers are provided with a material package from which they get the tools to work with the theme in their class. The campaign will be spread on the channels of both the Children and Youth Foundation (CYF) and Alma Media (including the Alma Media School Network website web pages and social media channels). Alma Media participates as par t of the READ campaign where the CYF works as an expert. In the READ campaign media and marketing communications companies are challenged to work together to reduce the number of young people uninspired to read. The READ campaign's global framework is the Little by Little program launched jointly by the UN and six of the world's largest marketing groups in the field of sustainable development. The workshops involve 80-100 high school students and 4 teachers 1200 to 1600 young people and 120 to 200 teachers in the school events and about 10000 to 30000 people through the communication campaign.
